summary: The 'Bring the Space Shuttle Home Act' mandates the transfer of the Discovery space shuttle from the Smithsonian Institution's Udvar-Hazy Center to NASA's Johnson Space Center in Houston, Texas. It directs NASA and the Smithsonian to create a transfer plan, including timelines and cost estimates.  The bill outlines stipulations for public exhibition near the Johnson Space Center and the eventual transfer of the shuttle's title to a designated non-profit. It authorizes appropriations to facilitate the transfer, aiming to promote STEM education.
